text: The infrared radiation absorbed by bacteriochlorophylls small organic molecules; many are photoheterotrophs.
On the other hand, infrared rays are available in water below the oxygenic phototrophs absorbing red and blue.
Thus, anaerobic phototrophs grow at depths where their more high-powered oxygenic relatives do not.
antenna complex of Rhodopseudomonas viridis contains 9 chlorophylls with chromophores facing parallel to the membrane (gold) and 18 with chromophores facing out from the ring (red).
The middle range includes bacteriochlorophyll and carotenoids.

Different chlorophyll types differ mainly in small substituents of the chromophore; for example, an aldehyde replaces the chlorophyll
Chlorophyll has a heterocyclic chromophore with a magnesium ion coordinated to four nitrogens.
